alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 11:38PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SCOTT AND NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Frankfort, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Stamping Ground, Longlick, Skinnersburg, Duval, Peaks Mill, Elmville, Minorsville, Biddle and Shiff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
